item.title: Shell scripts for converting between Unix and Windows text file formats
item.description: I’ve been using these shell scripts I wrote to convert between unix and windows text file formats. They seem to work well without any problems. If you put them in the /usr/sbin/ directory, they will be accessible on the path of the linux admin account root. /usr/sbin/unix2win `#!/bin/bash Converts a unix text file to a windows text file. usage: unix2win requirements: sed version 4.2 or later, check with sed –version sed -i -e ’s/$/r/’ $1 `
